sentences: But Frieden noted that officials expect it will be harder to contain the outbreak in Miami beach for several reasons.

Pregnant women are most vulnerable to Zika, because it has been linked with birth defects in infants, like microcephaly, which inhibits full brain formation.
Zika has its most devastating effect on pregnant women  —   arresting brain development in fetuses, who are born with shrunken heads.

Pregnant women are at greatest risk because the virus can have devastating consequences for an unborn baby, including the birth defect microcephaly and other neurological deficits, as well as miscarriage and stillbirth among women who were infected while pregnant.

THE WASHINGTON POST  The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention quickly issued a second travel advisory Friday afternoon, saying pregnant women should also avoid the designated area of Miami Beach.

The new updates said pregnant women and their partners should not go to the two affected areas, which now include a 1.  mile area on the island city of Miami Beach, which spans from Eighth Street in the south to 28th Street in the north.

Please follow the steps below, NEWS BRIEF Local cases of Zika infection have been found in Miami Beach, Florida Governor Rick Scott said Friday, which means the virus has spread beyond the small neighborhood that health officials had hoped to contain it to, and has infected one of South Florida’s largest tourist areas.
That brings the total number of Zika cases that have been spread by mosquitoes in Florida to 36.

Rick Scott confirmed Friday that the Zika virus is being spread locally by mosquitoes in Miami Beach, a development that marks an expansion of the outbreak in South Florida and immediately prompted a new travel advisory by federal officials.
On July 29, Scott announced that the first local transmission of the virus in the continental United States had occurred in the Wynwood neighborhood, north of downtown Miami.

Up until the Thursday, the Florida Department of Health had confined the zone of “active transmission”  —   in which you could encounter a   mosquito  —   to a square mile of   Country, near a neighborhood known as Wynwood.
The spread of Zika by local mosquitos had been confined to one spot just north of downtown Miami, a   mile area in the Wynwood neighborhood.
Health officials said at least five people have been infected with Zika in this area, including two who live in Miami Beach.
Five Zika cases have been linked to the new outbreak in Miami Beach, involving three men and two women from Miami, New York, Texas and Taiwan, officials said.
Of the five infected, three were tourists, and two live locally.
Florida’s busy tourist hub of Miami Beach is the second neighborhood in the state to harbor mosquitoes infected with the Zika virus, officials confirmed Friday.
Mosquitoes have begun spreading the Zika virus in a second part of Miami  —   the popular tourist destination of Miami Beach  —   Florida officials announced Friday.
